moves.1. e4 e5: To play a gambit, or to not play a gambit.
moves.4... Bg4: So I decide to rip the center open.
moves.5. dxe5 dxe5 6. fxe5 Nxe5: He thinks his Knight is safe.
moves.7... Rxd8: But if NxN, Rd8+. I didn't see anything but equalization from Rd8+, so I play NxN.
moves.10. Kg3 Bh5: Then I was hit by a brilliant, Rook winning combination!
moves.11. Bb5+: Well, I thought it was great. I forgot about the LSB.
moves.18. Kxe3 Ng4+ 19. Kd2 O-O: I didn't see the Knight check, but I did see the pawn and Bishop.
moves.21... Rd8+ 22. Nd2 Nxe5 23. c3: Excape route for King, though I should have played b3.
moves.23... Nc4 24. Ke1 Nxd2: Thankfully, he didn't take with the Rook.
moves.25. Rd1 Nf3+ 26. Ke2 Rxd1 27. Kxd1 Nxh2: Here, he said "see ya," and politely let the clock run out with six minutes left (it was blitz). Thank you, revken16, for this game!

gameName: Not 1, not 2, not 4, but 3 passed pawns!
